quiz.title: Foundations of Algebra (Quiz 7)
quiz.subtitle: Section 1.7: Distributive Property (10 Questions)
quiz.subject: Mathematics
quiz.topic: Applying the Distributive Property to Simplify Expressions

questions.question: What is the Distributive Property formula?
questions.explanation: The Distributive Property states that multiplying a sum by a number gives the same result as multiplying each addend by the number and then adding: a(b + c) = ab + ac.

questions.question: Apply the distributive property: 4(x + 5)
questions.explanation: 4(x + 5) = 4·x + 4·5 = 4x + 20. Multiply each term inside parentheses by 4.

questions.question: Use the distributive property: x(3x - 4)
questions.explanation: x(3x - 4) = x·3x + x·(-4) = 3x² - 4x. Remember: x times x = x².

questions.question: What is -(a - 7)?
questions.explanation: -(a - 7) = -1(a - 7) = -1·a + (-1)·(-7) = -a + 7. The negative sign distributes to both terms.

questions.question: Apply distribution: ½(6x - 8)
questions.explanation: ½(6x - 8) = ½·6x + ½·(-8) = 3x - 4. Fractions distribute just like whole numbers.

questions.question: The area of a rectangle is length × width. If width = 3 and length = (x + 4), what is the area?
questions.explanation: Area = 3(x + 4) = 3x + 12. This shows a real-world application of the distributive property.

scoreMessages.90: Excellent! You've mastered the distributive property, including negative signs and multiple steps.
scoreMessages.70: Good work! You understand distribution but review negative signs and combining with other terms.
scoreMessages.50: A fair attempt. Focus on: 1) Multiply each term inside, 2) Watch negative signs carefully, 3) Combine like terms after.
scoreMessages.0: Keep practicing! Remember: a(b + c) = ab + ac. Multiply the outside term by EVERY term inside parentheses.
